newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Yukong to set up U.S. oil subsidiary.
newsitem.headline: Yukong to set up U.S. oil subsidiary.

text.p: South Korea's Yukong Ltd said on Tuesday it would set up a subsidiary in the United States to manage oil and gas exploration and development projects in the U.S.
A company statement said the subsidiary was scheduled to start operation after being approved by the government.

Prior to establishing the subsidiary, Yukong has invested a total of $24 million to buy stakes in five oil and gas producing fields in the U.S. from Manti Resources Inc in late May. The project will be managed by Yukong's U.S. subsidiary.
Yukong has purchased a 49 percent stake in three fields in Texas and a 60 percent stake in two fields in Louisiana, it said.
The five fields have been producing 3,200 barrels of crude oil and gas a day.
